title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize and enhance the poison center national toll-free number, national media campaign, and grant program, and for other purposes.
short_title: Poison Center Network Enhancement Act of 2019
committees: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions Committee
latest_major_action: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.
summary: Poison Center Network Enhancement Act of 2019 This bill reauthorizes for FY2020-FY2024 and revises the national toll-free phone number, public awareness campaign, and grant program relating to poison control centers.  Among other changes, the bill  supports enhancements of the national toll-free phone number, such as texting capabilities; expands the public awareness campaign to include education about drug misuse; and authorizes poison control centers and professional organizations to use grant funds for preventing and treating the misuse of opioids and other drugs.
summary_short: Poison Center Network Enhancement Act of 2019 This bill reauthorizes for FY2020-FY2024 and revises the national toll-free phone number, public awareness campaign, and grant program relating to poison control centers.  Among other changes, the bill  supports enhancements of the national toll-free phone number, such as texting capabilities; expands the public awareness campaign to include education about drug misuse; and authorizes poison control centers and professional organizations to use gr...

actions.description: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 501.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Engel moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H2052-2053)
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H2052-2053)
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
